ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 117
ygData.messageBody:
<And I don't understand where you think we are "supposed to be the
most traveling class in Norrath". >

If you must know, I tought I had read it at the EQ/Station site. I went
back to check but I was mistaken, I must have read it somewhere else.

<. I think most Bards would prefer to have this "bug" in the game>
Why? When grouping with others it disrupts two of their most often used
spells? I would think the opposite would be true. Granted, I can always
get a SoW from someone in the group, but why let them waste the mana when
Selo's is faster (at least for me)?

-----Original Message-----
From: Wayne Sheppard <mrwayne@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Saturday, June 19, 1999 8:22 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Digest Number 117


>From: "Wayne Sheppard" <mrwayne@...>
>
>There are no plans to allow bards to bind themselves. Bind Affinity is for
>pure spellcasters, not hybrids or jack-of-all-trades. While Bards can
>travel a lot, we are the class that least needs Bind Affinity. With Selo,
>we can travel much faster than any other class (besides the high level gate
>spells). And I don't understand where you think we are "supposed to be the
>most traveling class in Norrath". My Cleric has traveled much more than my
>Bard, and this was before the Cleric had Bind Affinity.
>
>Selo's does disrupt SoW. This is most likely a bug. Selos also disrupts
>Root. This is most likely the same bug. Fixing one bug will fix the other
>bug. I think most Bards would prefer to have this "bug" in the game.
>Verant seems to be willing to leave it in for "gameplay".
>
>
>
>Wayne
>
>
>
>> Date: Fri, 18 Jun 1999 17:58:18 -0500
>> From: "Bard" <dabard@...>
>> Subject: (no subject)
>>
>> First off, yeah my character's name is Barrd (Supposed to be "Bard", but
>> that damned name filter...), which is a character I've RP'd since the
good
>> old days of NWN. So no need to "Hey, great name ;ppp" me, I've already
>> heard it all =oP
>> Question, does anyone know if there is any plan in the future for bards
to
>> be able to bind themselves? Just kinda seems silly that we're supposed
to
>> be the most traveling class in Norrath, but can't bind. =o/ Also, any
>word
>> on why Selo's disrupts other group member's SoW?
>>
>> -=B=-
>> NOR Bard, Esq.
>> Baron of The Nest
>> Proud Member of the New OutRiders
>> Layer of the Almighty Verbal Smackdown
>> And One Helluva Nice Guy :o)
>
>
>
